alert.note: Alert for Page; Rappahannock; Shenandoah; Warren (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 22 at 5:38PM EDT until June 22 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Page County in northwestern Virginia... Western Rappahannock County in northwestern Virginia... Eastern Shenandoah County in northwestern Virginia... Southwestern Warren County in northwestern Virginia... * Until 845 PM EDT. * At 538 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Strasburg... Woodstock... Luray... Mount Jackson... Sperryville... Edinburg... Maurertown... Toms Brook... Rileyville... Compton... Saint Davids Church... Kimball... Kings Crossing... Seven Fountains... Fairview... Panorama... Hamburg... Fourway... Skyland... Ida... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
